Add service to validate and generate barcodes
Automatically generate "next barcode" via CODABAR.

comments.body:
To get the next barcode:
Remove the check digit
Add 1 to the number
Sum all the digits, multiply by 2. If it's greater than 9, subtract 9.
Take the last digit of the result. If it's zero, the check digit is zero. Otherwise, 10 - digit is the check digit.

Try it out:

32101113342891
3210111334289 + 1 = 3210111334290
3+2+1+0+1+1+1+3+3+4+2+9+0 = 30 * 2 = 60 -9 = 51, 10-1 = 9.

Result: 32101113342909

Yay!

This is Luhn's algorithm I guess.

bibdata.title: Refactor bibliographic/:id/availability to use fewer alma API calls for CDL information

comments.body:
I believe this is already done. The code only makes the extra API call if the status is unavailable:

```
def holding_status(holding:, sequence:)
  ...
  elsif status[:status_label] == "Unavailable"
    # Notice that we only check if a holding is available via CDL when necessary
    # because it requires an extra (slow-ish) API call.
    status[:cdl] = cdl_holding?(holding["holding_id"])
  end
end
```

https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/alma/app/adapters/alma_adapter/availability_status.rb#L63-L66
@hackartisan I renamed the method and added a comment to indicate that we could also get the value from the table in the future.

dspace-development.title: Publishing a newly imported theses on dataspace-dev results in an error

comments.body:
The DSpace config is not set up with proper EZID credentials for testing ark minting.  

The arks handle minting service in `config/dspace.cfg` should be configured with the following values for dev:

```
handle.prefix = 99999                                                                                                                                                                                                         
ark.ezid_username = $USERNAME                                                                               
ark.ezid_password = $PASSWORD                                                                                           
ark.shoulder = fk4  
```

Test username and password are in LastPass. 

After updating the config, do a `dsrestart` for changes to take immediate effect.

princeton_ansible.title: Change approvals to use the staging postgres

comments.body:
I ran https://github.com/pulibrary/princeton_ansible/compare/main...2293-alma-prod-permissions and it corrected both the worker and bibdata-alma2.

However, I get the following error on bibdata-alma1:

```
TASK [roles/bibdata : Create mount directory] *********************************************
fatal: [bibdata-alma1.princeton.edu]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "msg": "There was an issue creating /data/marc_liberation_files as requested: [Errno 17] File exists: '/data/marc_
liberation_files'", "path": "/data/marc_liberation_files"}                                                                                                                            
ok: [bibdata-alma2.princeton.edu]                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                      
TASK [roles/bibdata : Create marc_liberation data mount /data/marc_liberation_files] ******                                                                                           
ok: [bibdata-alma2.princeton.edu]                                                          
                                                                                           
TASK [roles/bibdata : Create marc_liberation data mount /data/marc_liberation_files/scsb_update_files] ***                                                                            
fatal: [bibdata-alma2.princeton.edu]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "msg": "Error mounting /data/marc_liberation_files/scsb_update_files: mount error(16): Device or resource busy\nRe
fer to the mount.cifs(8) manual page (e.g. man mount.cifs)\n"}                             
...ignoring                                                                                                                                                                           
                   
```

And when listing that dir:

```
deploy@bibdata-alma1:~$ ls -l /data/
ls: cannot access '/data/marc_liberation_files': Remote I/O error
total 0
d????????? ? ? ? ?            ? marc_liberation_files
```

it doesn't look like it mounted the SMB connection. 

```bash
pulsys@bibdata-alma2:~$ cat /etc/fstab
# /etc/fstab: static file system information.
#
# Use 'blkid' to print the universally unique identifier for a
# device; this may be used with UUID= as a more robust way to name devices
# that works even if disks are added and removed. See fstab(5).
#
# <file system> <mount point>   <type>  <options>       <dump>  <pass>
/dev/mapper/lib--vg-root /               ext4    errors=remount-ro 0       1
/dev/mapper/lib--vg-swap_1 none            swap    sw              0       0
//diglibdata1.princeton.edu/hydra/binaries/ingest_scratch/bibdata_scratch /mnt/isilon/ingest_scratch cifs credentials=/etc/scratch.smb.credentials,uid=1001,gid=33 0 0
//10.6.49.226/bi-library-hr /mnt/dms-smbserve/bi-library-hr cifs defaults,uid=33,gid=1001,credentials=/etc/hr_share.smb.credentials 0 0
//bibdata-alma-worker1.princeton.edu/marc_liberation_files /data/marc_liberation_files cifs credentials=/etc/bibdata-worker.smb.credentials,uid=1001,gid=1001 0 0
//bibdata-alma-worker1.princeton.edu/marc_liberation_files/scsb_update_files /data/marc_liberation_files/scsb_update_files cifs credentials=/etc/bibdata-worker.smb.credentials,uid=1001,gid=1001 0 0
//bibdata-alma-worker1.princeton.edu/marc_liberation_files/campus_access_files /data/marc_liberation_files/campus_access_files cifs credentials=/etc/bibdata-worker.smb.credentials,uid=1001,gid=1001,file_mode=0775,dir_mode=0775 0 0
```

vs

```bash
pulsys@bibdata-alma1:~$ cat /etc/fstab
# /etc/fstab: static file system information.
#
# Use 'blkid' to print the universally unique identifier for a
# device; this may be used with UUID= as a more robust way to name devices
# that works even if disks are added and removed. See fstab(5).
#
# <file system> <mount point>   <type>  <options>       <dump>  <pass>
/dev/mapper/lib--vg-root /               ext4    errors=remount-ro 0       1
/dev/mapper/lib--vg-swap_1 none            swap    sw              0       0
//diglibdata1.princeton.edu/hydra/binaries/ingest_scratch/bibdata_scratch /mnt/isilon/ingest_scratch cifs credentials=/etc/scratch.smb.credentials,uid=1001,gid=33 0 0
//10.6.49.226/bi-library-hr /mnt/dms-smbserve/bi-library-hr cifs defaults,uid=33,gid=1001,credentials=/etc/hr_share.smb.credentials 0 0
//bibdata-alma-worker1.princeton.edu/marc_liberation_files /data/marc_liberation_files cifs credentials=/etc/bibdata-worker.smb.credentials,uid=1001,gid=1001 0 0
```
It worked when I remembered @carolyncole's advice for when mounts fail: just try running it again

requests.title: Status lozenge on the UI should show either Available or Unavailable not the real status

comments.body:
Based on current user feedback relayed from Alma Blacklight Open Houses there is a demand for staff to see the detailed statuses somehwere and the request form is the only place it can feasibly be provided due to Alma's API limitations for records that are not in the standard "Item In Place" location, the recommendations was to print out:

"Not Available - {status_lable}"

Ex: "Not Available - Lost"

requests.title: Changing from looking at library location to remote_storage location …
ReCAP Flag Should be calculated using the remote storage flag

comments.body:
In order for SCSB to work with PUL owned items that are shelved in a remote_storage location when the request is placed it needs to:

1. Place a SCSB Physical Item Request for the item in question
2. If that is successful, place an Alma hold request for the same item. These requests should be identical to the hold requests that will be placed in Alma when this ticket is complete: https://github.com/pulibrary/requests/issues/933. 

Materials owned by SCSB partners will still only need a single SCSB Physical item request placed as we do with our current functionality.

mendel$pk is the only location with remote_storage="recap_rmt" catalog-alma-qa that has some items in it. 

https://catalog-alma-qa.princeton.edu/catalog?utf8=%E2%9C%93&f1=all_fields&q1=&op2=AND&f2=author&q2=&op3=AND&f3=title&q3=&f_inclusive%5Badvanced_location_s%5D%5B%5D=mendel%24pk&range%5Bpub_date_start_sort%5D%5Bbegin%5D=&range%5Bpub_date_start_sort%5D%5Bend%5D=&sort=score+desc%2C+pub_date_start_sort+desc%2C+title_sort+asc&search_field=advanced&commit=Search

requests.title: Create Alma Hold Request for PUL Owned Items in ReCAP

comments.body:
I think we want to order the two requests like this:

1, Place a SCSB Physical Item Request for the item in question
2. If that is successful, place an Alma hold request for the same item. These requests should be identical to the hold requests in #933.
